subject: p19182863
History: Left apical pneumothorax after bronchoscopy, to assess for change.
Findings: In comparison with the study of, the sharp pleural line is no longer seen in the left apical region. There may be a residual tiny pneumothorax in the left apex. Continued enlargement of the cardiac silhouette. Mild indistinctness of pulmonary vessels suggests some elevated pulmonary venous pressure. Retrocardiac opacification persists, consistent with some volume loss in the lower lobe. Overlying wires obscure the lower portion of the right hemithorax.
